meanings.definition: To stimulate or excite (someone) by increasing adrenaline levels.
meanings.sent1: The thrilling roller coaster ride really adrenalized me.
meanings.sent2: The intense music at the concert adrenalized the crowd.
meanings.sent3: After drinking too much coffee, I felt so adrenalized that I couldn't sit still.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news adrenalized her like a bolt of lightning.
meanings.sent5: The action-packed movie scene was so adrenalizing that it left me breathless.

meanings.definition: To make (someone) more alert or energetic.
meanings.sent1: The strong coffee in the morning always adrenalizes me for the day ahead.
meanings.sent2: Exercising in the fresh air can adrenalize your mind and body.
meanings.sent3: The loud alarm clock adrenalized me out of bed this morning.
meanings.sent4: The inspiring speech adrenalized the team to work harder.
meanings.sent5: The competitive spirit of the game adrenalized the players to give their all.
